intro: Geonoma altissima, commonly known as the tall bryophyte fern, is a species of moss that belongs to the family Hypnaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and dark green, glossy foliage. This plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rock crevices. Its small, oval-shaped leaves are arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Geonoma altissima plays an important ecological role in nutrient cycling and soil stabilization in its habitat.
